Heya,

> Here's another thought: what if we could, when creating a scenario,
> specify what abilities opponents could and could not use.  That way I
> could put a high level mage around, but take away the ability to
> freeze time.  Or put a high-level archmage around, and prevent him
> from accessing chain-lightning.

That would be cool, though I suspect it'd require changes to the game code
(read: another patch) as right now the game probably works out what
abilities someone has from their level.

I'm not sure how much work would be required to implement it however I
suspect it to be reasonable depending on if the abilities are separated from
the level  (so when it checks it just says "ok, at this level this, this and
this abilitiy is on") or if they are somehow merged.
Then you have to override the automatic checking for NPC's (I assume you
don't want to be applying this to players :) ) during scenario loads,
although that could probably be achieved by a flag - nice and simple.

It's not something I think you could do with the scenario editor :)

Cya,
Deathifier
